blog.title: My Imagination Never Stops
blog.description: Welcome! I'm Dove! This little blog is just a collection of my ideas, thoughts, opinions, and things I enjoy.

body:
I’m Not All Bitter, See?

I know I sound insanely bitter LOL, so here’s a list of some good things in Endgame.

  • A central role for Natasha, even if it ended in Pain
  • LOTS of screentime for Nebula. We love one angry blue cyborg. 
  • Almost everyone lost in Infinity War came back!
  • Gamora and Nebula were reunited.
  • THE SUPER LADIES IN BATTLE SCENE (I don’t care if y’all think it’s “pandering,” I was so happy to see how far the MCU has come.) 
  • Wanda holding her own against Thanos basically single-handedly 
  • Same for Carol 
  • Tony and Peter share a hug!
  • TONY BEING A DAD!
  • Nebula winning a game at the very beginning, can you imagine how that felt after a life losing to Gamora? <3
  • Bruce resolving his Hulk problem and coming to peace with both parts of himself.
  • From the looks of it, Wakanda was fully rebuilt in the end 
  • Steve is worthy!!! 
  • Thor receiving the comfort he so desperately needs from his mom Frigga.
  • Valkyrie is queen of New Asgard now!
  • Even though Tony’s death was PAIN, his service at the end was very nice, esp. seeing all the team gathered for him. (I think I even spotted Harley Keener from the third Iron Man.) 
  • Pepper and Tony fighting together 
  • Potential for GoTG Vol 3. Not gonna lie, is was looking pretty dismal at the end of Infinity War for them.
  • Nebula and Rocket sharing a soft moment of comfort when Nebula comes back safely from space. 
  • Carol is super confident in herself and we love that.
  • All the ladies teaming up to Protect Peter 
  • Tony being given the space to express his ongoing hurt about how he suffered from Thanos and how he feels betrayed by Steve. (It was nice to see them remembering he’s human and allowing his vulnerable side to still be an important part of his character.) 
  • Brief montage of Tony and Nebula doing science together. Also, the later montage of Nebula, Rocket, Bruce, and Tony working together.
  • Scott getting to show off his smarts! He’s goofy, but he really does know what he’s doing. 
  • Rocket using his own experiences to give Thor a pretty genuine pep talk and reminder that he can do this
  • Everyone properly mourning Nat and showing how much she meant to the team.
  • Sam Wilson as the next Captain America
  • YIBAMBE! 
  • AVENGERS….ASSEMBLE.

title: Swallowed By Darkness
body:
Peter ParkerxReader

Dad!Tony

Word Count: 2,470

Summary: You were both so different now, but you just didn’t want to be alone anymore.

A/N: Endgame spoilers, mentions of sex and attempted suicide.

He never wanted this life for you. The life where you put yourself in danger to save people. He wanted you to have every chance to change the world, but not the way he did. Not the way that brought nightmares and unease. Not the way of a superhero. Not the way of a young woman pushing herself past every breaking point.

He sacrificed everything for you, to bring you back. So that you’d get to have the life he always wanted you to have.

God, you were only 16. You were too young to lose your dad. You were too young to step up the way you had. You were too young to be worrying about your little sisters future the way you did, you weren’t even present for those first 5 years of her life. Your dad wanted your life to be amazing, he wanted that for Morgan too, and you’d be damned sure she got to have that.

You’d make sure she remembered every last good thing your father did to save the entire universe and then some.

Even if it meant that you wouldn’t have that. Because when your dad told you take care of your mom and sister and that was exactly what you’d do. Even through the darkness. Even through losing people you never thought you would. Even if you had to lose yourself in the process. You would do anything your dad asked you to do.

After the battle with Thanos, after everything you’d been through, nothing was the same. Your mother said she told him that you’d all be okay, that he could rest. You hadn’t made it to them in time to say any form of goodbye. It tore you apart. How you wondered what your father would think now if he saw the people he loved.

Pepper knew nothing but work now. She loved her girls, but they were so much like him. Family was her top priority, she loved with everything she had, but you knew she took longer work trips and stayed late just so she wouldn’t have to spend so much time with the two of you.

Morgan, well, she missed him everyday. She wished every single day she could have had more time with him. She wished that instead of you holding the family together the way you did wasn’t how things were. But, she was grateful for all of it. She loved you with everything she had. It broke her heart seeing you the way you’d become, seeing other become different too.

Every single person that Tony Stark touched was different now that he was gone.

However, you’d argue there was one in particular that changed even more than you had.

You hated yourself for letting it happen. He tried so hard to reach out to you. He tried to help you when someone should have been helping him. In the end, when you pushed him away, you regretted it instantly. Your dad brought you back with everyone else that was lost to the snap. You hadn’t been there with them on Titan when the snap happened. But the second the two of you found each other on the battlefield for that final fight, the two of you fell into the sync you’d both grown accustomed to.

You and Peter had it, whatever it was. You always had. He cared so deeply for your father and for you. You could feel it in your bones how much he cared.

You only wished you could have been less focused on other things to notice. He was slipping and you practically stomped on his fingers. He held onto you for as long as he could. He tried being there for you and you could only manage to push him away. You’d been so concerned about so many other things and people, and with how he was trying to be there for you, you hadn’t realized he needed someone too. He needed you because you weren’t just Tony’s daughter to him.

You were so much more to him, he loved you, even at 16.

Well, now it was 6 years later and things were so much different.

Your sister was away for school, your mother was still living on the lake, and you were in the city. You kept it safe the best you could.

However, every so often he’d come along, just to chat. Oh but it wasn’t because he cared.

No, Peter didn’t care for much of anything anymore. Only the monster that ran through his veins.

You were sat on the railing out on the towers balcony. It wasn’t Avengers tower anymore, but it was once your home and you still came back every now and then. The company that bought it those many years ago went bankrupt, it was all but empty now, you bought it back and lived there, all the way at the top. You sat on the edge whenever you had bad nights, contemplating if you’d really just let yourself fall this time.

The last time you had finally started your decline you were picked right out of the sky. He wouldn’t talk about that night with you.

There was the soft pad of feet behind you. You didn’t bother to turn around, you knew.

“We won’t catch you this time,” his voice sounded deeper and frankly distorted. It was so different than it had been when the two of you were young and still light hearted.

You wiped the tears from your face as he got closer. “Don’t you have trouble to be getting into, Pete?” You didn’t look back, knowing that you would not find the sweet Peter Parker from long ago. Instead you knew you’d find him donned in what looked like his Spider-Man suit, but what was actually an alien species that called itself Venom.

“What do you think I’m doing here?” He asked.

You could hear the smirk in his voice. “Go… I’m in no mood for you to tell me of all the horrible things you’ve been up to, or to argue let alone fight you. We are not friends.” Even though they were your own words they broke you up. You wanted nothing more than for him to stay.

A low growl was released in your ear. He was practically against your back, but he left enough space so he wasn’t. “What about being in the mood for something else?”

A shiver swept down your spine. You stayed silent for a moment, you knew what he meant. “What do you think?”

He didn’t answer you, but you were sure he didn’t care.

You listened to the sound of Venom retracting. It was nothing like the sound of the nano tech that made up your own suit. Then a pair of lips settled against your shoulder, pulling your from your thoughts and making you pull away. You slipped off the side of the rail, quickly you tapped the arc reactor on your chest. Your all (your fave color) suit formed over your body as you fell.

As tempting as it was, you flew right back up.

“Come on Y/N, you know hate sex is the best outlet.”

You scoffed and shook your head. “I told you. That was a mistake. One I’m never making again.”

Peter smirked at you, a brow arched. “You sure about that?” The black symbiote shot out for you, it wrapped around your waist and pulled you right into him. He tapped your arc reactor and loosened his grip on you once your suit was gone.

You looked away from him, knowing struggling against him would only make him hold you tighter.

His hand came up and stroked through your hair. His other cupped your chin and turned your head back towards him.

His eyes were so much darker than you remember. You missed the sweet brown they used to be. How bright they were. Now the darkness around them practically made them black.

Yet even through that darkness you could see it, the want he had for you.

It was undeniable. It was always there, and the first time you gave into him, you didn’t regret it. You just wished the circumstances were different. But here you were, falling back into him.

He pulled you in closer and kissed you.

It happened quickly, you ended up back in the penthouse, not even making it to your room the two of you wound up on the couch.

Clothes were shed, bodies pressed together, being with Peter was pure ecstacy.

It was the only time you didn’t feel alone.

The only moments where you felt something other than the pain of your past.

You laid on Peter’s chest, both of you panting.

And even covered in sweat, being there like that felt right. Like nothing was ever going to be as right as you being with him.

Perhaps it was all of the pain you’d been thinking about prior to all of this. Or maybe it was because deep down you knew how you felt for him. But the words slipped passed your lips so quietly and without warning.

“Stay with me tonight.”

You could feel his body tense, you almost backpedaled but his words silenced anything that may have come to mind.

“You know I can’t do that,” he said firmly, like he was making sure not only you knew but almost as if he was trying to convince himself of the answer as well.

You tried to stop the tears that filled your eyes but they slipped to his chest before you could will them away. “Please, I-… I don’t trust myself to be alone…”

He sat up, taking you with him. His hands held your shoulders and he forced you to look at him. “And I don’t trust myself to be alone with you like that.”

“How is it any different than this right now?” You asked, timidly.

He shook his head as if you should understand exactly what he meant. He shifted you from his lap and started replacing his clothes. You followed suit and put your own back on, expecting an uncomfortable conversation to happen was not something you wanted to do naked.

He answered you once his pants were back on. “This… this is just sex, Y/N. That’s how it’s different. Nothing is going to come from this. It can’t, I won’t let it. I won’t let you get hurt by us. You have no idea what I am now. What we can do and not even know it. We could kill you in your sleep and you wouldn’t even see it coming.”

“Please, Pete…” you said it barely above a whisper. You were not one to beg but you couldn’t help yourself. You needed him.

The symbiote covered his skin. The man you just gave your body to, was replaced by his monstrous other half. “Find someone else if you need someone that bad. I’ve hurt you enough. I won’t do it anymore.”

Rage filled your heart. If only he knew that his solution was more painful than anything else he could have done. “Go.” You said it with such anger in your voice he thought he just misheard you.

“What?”

“GET OUT AND NEVER COME BACK,” you screamed at the top of your lungs.

Venom retracted, Peter could only look at you in utter shock.

“One night!” You sobbed. “That was all I was asking for… jus-just a few hours of not being fucking alone and miserable. But it’s fine. Really Peter, go and leave me alone so I can stop acting like you care about anything other than yourself! I’m the biggest fucking idiot to ever think you could care about me anymore. I’m just the only person stupid enough to let you fuck them, right? That’s why you came, not for any other reason. You act like you were the only person to lose my dad to that fucking war. Everyone just worried about my mom and Morgan, and I got to pick up the pieces with no one there for me! At least you had people! Even I tried to help you and what did I get for it? Absolutely no concern at all! Not even a fucking are you doing okay? And after all these years I finally had the courage to ask for something, anything to keep me from killing myself and you can’t even just be honest and tell me you hate me! Face it, I know you can’t stand being around me. That you’re just using me. I won’t make this mistake again.”

You stormed off to your bedroom as he stood there, completely in shock and pain at your words.

He never wanted to hurt you. Why did he have to be this way? He followed after you, not even sure what he’d say to you after that.

You could feel him following you, so instead of continuing on you whipped around on him and went for him. You shoved him, as hard as you could but he barely even took a step back.

He grabbed your wrists and pulled you into his arms.

“Let go,” you said, struggling against him.

He only held you tighter.

“Don’t pretend you actually care,” you sobbed, not even bothering to continue struggling against him.

But then his body shook against yours.

You stilled completely.

“I-I can’t lose you,” he said quietly as he sobbed against you. “Please… believe me… I do care. I-I just don’t know how to show that anymore…I would stay if I could, if I could I’d never leave your side, Y/N… but I’m not who I used to be… and I don’t expect you to accept me like this… you deserve better than me… I’ve hurt you too much already.”

You pulled back and forced him to look at you. “Pete…”

He shook his head. “I don’t deserve you even speaking to me let alone anything more than that.”

“Yes, you do. We’ve both had things tough… we both have made mistakes… but… how about we don’t let this be a mistake?”

“I don’t trust Venom to not hurt you,” he pressed his forehead to yours.

You wiped some tears from his cheeks as well as your own. “It wouldn’t be your fault if he did and I don’t believe he would or he would have done it by now, right?”

Peter was quiet for a moment as if he was listening to something, you assumed it was to the symbiote. “He said you’re right… but what if he’s lying?”

“That’s a risk I’m willing to take,” you said before pulling him towards your room.

That was the best night’s sleep both of you had in as long as you could remember.

You wiped the tears from your face as he got closer. “Don’t you have trouble to be getting into, Pete?” You didn’t look back, knowing that you would not find the sweet Peter Parker from long ago. Instead you knew you’d find him donned in what looked like his Spider-Man suit, but what was actually an alien species that called itself Venom.

“What do you think I’m doing here?” He asked.

You could hear the smirk in his voice. “Go… I’m in no mood for you to tell me of all the horrible things you’ve been up to, or to argue let alone fight you. We are not friends.” Even though they were your own words they broke you up. You wanted nothing more than for him to stay.

A low growl was released in your ear. He was practically against your back, but he left enough space so he wasn’t. “What about being in the mood for something else?”

A shiver swept down your spine. You stayed silent for a moment, you knew what he meant. “What do you think?”

He didn’t answer you, but you were sure he didn’t care.

You listened to the sound of Venom retracting. It was nothing like the sound of the nano tech that made up your own suit. Then a pair of lips settled against your shoulder, pulling your from your thoughts and making you pull away. You slipped off the side of the rail, quickly you tapped the arc reactor on your chest. Your all (your fave color) suit formed over your body as you fell.

As tempting as it was, you flew right back up.

“Come on Y/N, you know hate sex is the best outlet.”

You scoffed and shook your head. “I told you. That was a mistake. One I’m never making again.”

Peter smirked at you, a brow arched. “You sure about that?” The black symbiote shot out for you, it wrapped around your waist and pulled you right into him. He tapped your arc reactor and loosened his grip on you once your suit was gone.

You looked away from him, knowing struggling against him would only make him hold you tighter.

His hand came up and stroked through your hair. His other cupped your chin and turned your head back towards him.

His eyes were so much darker than you remember. You missed the sweet brown they used to be. How bright they were. Now the darkness around them practically made them black.

Yet even through that darkness you could see it, the want he had for you.

It was undeniable. It was always there, and the first time you gave into him, you didn’t regret it. You just wished the circumstances were different. But here you were, falling back into him.

He pulled you in closer and kissed you.

It happened quickly, you ended up back in the penthouse, not even making it to your room the two of you wound up on the couch.

Clothes were shed, bodies pressed together, being with Peter was pure ecstacy.

It was the only time you didn’t feel alone.

The only moments where you felt something other than the pain of your past.

You laid on Peter’s chest, both of you panting.

And even covered in sweat, being there like that felt right. Like nothing was ever going to be as right as you being with him.

Perhaps it was all of the pain you’d been thinking about prior to all of this. Or maybe it was because deep down you knew how you felt for him. But the words slipped passed your lips so quietly and without warning.

“Stay with me tonight.”

You could feel his body tense, you almost backpedaled but his words silenced anything that may have come to mind.

“You know I can’t do that,” he said firmly, like he was making sure not only you knew but almost as if he was trying to convince himself of the answer as well.

You tried to stop the tears that filled your eyes but they slipped to his chest before you could will them away. “Please, I-… I don’t trust myself to be alone…”

He sat up, taking you with him. His hands held your shoulders and he forced you to look at him. “And I don’t trust myself to be alone with you like that.”

“How is it any different than this right now?” You asked, timidly.

He shook his head as if you should understand exactly what he meant. He shifted you from his lap and started replacing his clothes. You followed suit and put your own back on, expecting an uncomfortable conversation to happen was not something you wanted to do naked.

He answered you once his pants were back on. “This… this is just sex, Y/N. That’s how it’s different. Nothing is going to come from this. It can’t, I won’t let it. I won’t let you get hurt by us. You have no idea what I am now. What we can do and not even know it. We could kill you in your sleep and you wouldn’t even see it coming.”

“Please, Pete…” you said it barely above a whisper. You were not one to beg but you couldn’t help yourself. You needed him.

The symbiote covered his skin. The man you just gave your body to, was replaced by his monstrous other half. “Find someone else if you need someone that bad. I’ve hurt you enough. I won’t do it anymore.”

Rage filled your heart. If only he knew that his solution was more painful than anything else he could have done. “Go.” You said it with such anger in your voice he thought he just misheard you.

“What?”

“GET OUT AND NEVER COME BACK,” you screamed at the top of your lungs.

Venom retracted, Peter could only look at you in utter shock.

“One night!” You sobbed. “That was all I was asking for… jus-just a few hours of not being fucking alone and miserable. But it’s fine. Really Peter, go and leave me alone so I can stop acting like you care about anything other than yourself! I’m the biggest fucking idiot to ever think you could care about me anymore. I’m just the only person stupid enough to let you fuck them, right? That’s why you came, not for any other reason. You act like you were the only person to lose my dad to that fucking war. Everyone just worried about my mom and Morgan, and I got to pick up the pieces with no one there for me! At least you had people! Even I tried to help you and what did I get for it? Absolutely no concern at all! Not even a fucking are you doing okay? And after all these years I finally had the courage to ask for something, anything to keep me from killing myself and you can’t even just be honest and tell me you hate me! Face it, I know you can’t stand being around me. That you’re just using me. I won’t make this mistake again.”

You stormed off to your bedroom as he stood there, completely in shock and pain at your words.

He never wanted to hurt you. Why did he have to be this way? He followed after you, not even sure what he’d say to you after that.

You could feel him following you, so instead of continuing on you whipped around on him and went for him. You shoved him, as hard as you could but he barely even took a step back.

He grabbed your wrists and pulled you into his arms.

“Let go,” you said, struggling against him.

He only held you tighter.

“Don’t pretend you actually care,” you sobbed, not even bothering to continue struggling against him.

But then his body shook against yours.

You stilled completely.

“I-I can’t lose you,” he said quietly as he sobbed against you. “Please… believe me… I do care. I-I just don’t know how to show that anymore…I would stay if I could, if I could I’d never leave your side, Y/N… but I’m not who I used to be… and I don’t expect you to accept me like this… you deserve better than me… I’ve hurt you too much already.”

You pulled back and forced him to look at you. “Pete…”

He shook his head. “I don’t deserve you even speaking to me let alone anything more than that.”

“Yes, you do. We’ve both had things tough… we both have made mistakes… but… how about we don’t let this be a mistake?”

“I don’t trust Venom to not hurt you,” he pressed his forehead to yours.

You wiped some tears from his cheeks as well as your own. “It wouldn’t be your fault if he did and I don’t believe he would or he would have done it by now, right?”

Peter was quiet for a moment as if he was listening to something, you assumed it was to the symbiote. “He said you’re right… but what if he’s lying?”

“That’s a risk I’m willing to take,” you said before pulling him towards your room.

That was the best night’s sleep both of you had in as long as you could remember.

Venom retracted, Peter could only look at you in utter shock.

“One night!” You sobbed. “That was all I was asking for… jus-just a few hours of not being fucking alone and miserable. But it’s fine. Really Peter, go and leave me alone so I can stop acting like you care about anything other than yourself! I’m the biggest fucking idiot to ever think you could care about me anymore. I’m just the only person stupid enough to let you fuck them, right? That’s why you came, not for any other reason. You act like you were the only person to lose my dad to that fucking war. Everyone just worried about my mom and Morgan, and I got to pick up the pieces with no one there for me! At least you had people! Even I tried to help you and what did I get for it? Absolutely no concern at all! Not even a fucking are you doing okay? And after all these years I finally had the courage to ask for something, anything to keep me from killing myself and you can’t even just be honest and tell me you hate me! Face it, I know you can’t stand being around me. That you’re just using me. I won’t make this mistake again.”

You stormed off to your bedroom as he stood there, completely in shock and pain at your words.

He never wanted to hurt you. Why did he have to be this way? He followed after you, not even sure what he’d say to you after that.

You could feel him following you, so instead of continuing on you whipped around on him and went for him. You shoved him, as hard as you could but he barely even took a step back.

He grabbed your wrists and pulled you into his arms.

“Let go,” you said, struggling against him.

He only held you tighter.

“Don’t pretend you actually care,” you sobbed, not even bothering to continue struggling against him.

But then his body shook against yours.

You stilled completely.

“I-I can’t lose you,” he said quietly as he sobbed against you. “Please… believe me… I do care. I-I just don’t know how to show that anymore…I would stay if I could, if I could I’d never leave your side, Y/N… but I’m not who I used to be… and I don’t expect you to accept me like this… you deserve better than me… I’ve hurt you too much already.”

You pulled back and forced him to look at you. “Pete…”

He shook his head. “I don’t deserve you even speaking to me let alone anything more than that.”

“Yes, you do. We’ve both had things tough… we both have made mistakes… but… how about we don’t let this be a mistake?”

“I don’t trust Venom to not hurt you,” he pressed his forehead to yours.

You wiped some tears from his cheeks as well as your own. “It wouldn’t be your fault if he did and I don’t believe he would or he would have done it by now, right?”

Peter was quiet for a moment as if he was listening to something, you assumed it was to the symbiote. “He said you’re right… but what if he’s lying?”

“That’s a risk I’m willing to take,” you said before pulling him towards your room.

That was the best night’s sleep both of you had in as long as you could remember.

summary: Captain America Trilogy | The Way  CharCubed shared this on twitter (vid is by shimmy on YT) and it’s beautifully made and...
caption:
Captain America Trilogy | The Way

CharCubed shared this on twitter (vid is by shimmy on YT) and it’s beautifully made and wonderfully illustrates why Steve’s ending in Endgame is so infuriating to so many Steve fans. Because these are Steve fans, who are upset. I want him to be happy, but happiness that sacrifices his character and his arc is an insult. It’s in insult to Steve Rogers to sloppily write an ooc ending because you didn’t want to think about it too hard (which is exactly what happened, as has become astonishingly clear in the recent interviews with the writers and directors).

summary:
Whoah! JOHN WICK: CHAPTER 3 Topples ‘Avengers: Endgame’

The numbers are in and the unexpected happened. I thought...
caption:
Whoah! JOHN WICK: CHAPTER 3 Topples ‘Avengers: Endgame’

The numbers are in and the unexpected happened. I thought #AvengersEndgame would continue to hold the #1 spot for weeks on end, but it just got toppled by none other than #JohnWickChapter3 because everybody and their grandma flocked to the theaters to watch #KeanuReeves kick ass again and help make the movie take the throne with $57 Million domestically and about $92 Million internationally bringing the film’s current worldwide total to $149 Million and counting.
